intro: Dorstenia cayapia var. typica, commonly known as the Cayapia mountain spinach, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that resemble a spiral staircase. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the early morning. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
